etymology.description: Duplication of 屮(屮) (chè, "grass") -> depicts blades of grass
etymology.interpretation: The character 艸(艸) (cǎo, "grass") is a pictogram representing grass blades. It duplicates the character 屮(屮) (chè, "grass") to emphasize the appearance of grass.

examples.chinese: 草铺满了田野(艸鋪滿了田野)。
微风拂过草原(微風拂過艸原)，晨露滋润万物(晨露滋潤萬物)。
examples.pinyin: Wēi fēng fú guò cǎoyuán, chén lù zī rùn wànwù.
examples.english: A gentle breeze blows over the grassland, and morning dew nourishes all things.

examples.chinese: 孩子们在草地上奔跑(孩子們在艸地上奔跑)。
